post.description: An array of domains should be provided in the body.
post.summary: Create multiple domains in a single request.

get.description:
Return is arranged by relationship (father:[children])
and category (category:[objects]), starting with "Root":[sites].
User permissions apply.

Return is arranged by hierarchyName (objHierarchyName:{attributes}).
User permissions apply.

Return is arranged by relationship (father:[children]),
starting with "Root":[root domains].

post.description:
Create a new JWT Key. This can also be used to verify credentials
The authorize and 'Try it out' buttons don't work
post.summary: Generates a new JWT Key for the client.

parameters.description: Mandatory: email and password.
parameters.name: body

get.description:
Gets an object from any of the physical entities with no need to specify it.
The hierarchyName must be provided in the URL as a parameter.
get.summary: Get an object from any entity.

parameters.description: hierarchyName of the object
parameters.name: hierarchyName

parameters.description: specify which object field to show in response. Multiple fieldOnly can be added. An invalid field is simply ignored.
parameters.name: fieldOnly

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated >= startDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated <= endDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: endDate

200.description: Found. A response body will be returned with a meaningful message.

404.description: Not Found. An error message will be returned.

get.summary: Get a list of projects for the specified user.

parameters.description: Email of the user whose projects are being requested. Example: /api/projects?user=user@test.com
parameters.name: user

400.description: Bad Request. Invalid user query param.

parameters.description: Mandatory: name, dateRange, namespace, attributes, objects, permissions, authorLastUpdate, lastUpdate. Optional: showAvg, showSum, isPublic.
parameters.name: body

put.summary: Replace the data of an existing project.

parameters.description: ID of the project to update.
parameters.name: ProjectID

parameters.description: Mandatory: name, dateRange, namespace, attributes, objects, permissions, authorLastUpdate, lastUpdate. Optional: showAvg, showSum, isPublic.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: ID of the project to delete.
parameters.name: ProjectID

get.summary: Gets the temperatureUnit attribute of the parent site of given object.

parameters.description: ID or hierarchy name of desired object. For templates the slug is the ID.
parameters.name: IdOrHierarchyName

get.summary: Verify if token sent in the header is valid.
Get a list of users that the caller is allowed to see.

post.description:
Create an account with email and password credentials, it returns
a JWT key to use with the API.

parameters.description: Mandatory: email, password and roles. Optional: name. Roles is an object with domains as keys and roles as values. Possible roles: manager, user and viewer
parameters.name: body

post.summary: Create multiples users with one request.

parameters.description: An array of users. Same mandatory and optional parameters as user apply, except for password. If not provided, one will be automatically created by the API.
parameters.name: body

post.summary: For logged in user to change its own password.

parameters.description: Mandatory: currentPassword and newPassword.
parameters.name: body

post.description:
Public endpoint to request a reset of a user's password (forgot my password).
If the email is valid, an email with a reset token/link will be sent to the user.

parameters.description: Mandatory: email.
parameters.name: body

200.description: request processed. If account exists, an email with a reset token is sent

post.description:
For user that first called forgot enpoint to change its password.
A reset token generated by the forgot endpoint should be provided as the Authentication header.

parameters.description: Mandatory: currentPassword and newPassword.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: The ID of the user to delete
parameters.name: userid

patch.summary: Modify user permissions: domain and role.

parameters.description: The ID of the user to modify roles
parameters.name: userid

parameters.description: An object with domains as keys and roles as values
parameters.name: roles

post.summary: Checks the received data and verifies if the object can be created in the system.

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices.
parameters.name: entity

200.description: OK. A response body will be returned with version details.

get.description: Returns JSON body with all specified objects of type.
get.summary: Gets all present objects for specified entity (category).

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: specify which object field to show in response. Multiple fieldOnly can be added. An invalid field is simply ignored.
parameters.name: fieldOnly

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated >= startDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated <= endDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: endDate

post.summary: Creates an object of the given entity in the system.

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices.
parameters.name: entity

get.description: The ID or hierarchy name must be provided in the URL parameter.
get.summary: Gets an Object of the given entity.

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: ID or hierarchy name of desired object. For templates the slug is the ID.

parameters.description: specify which object field to show in response. Multiple fieldOnly can be added. An invalid field is simply ignored.

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated >= startDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated <= endDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: endDate

delete.summary: Deletes an Object in the system.

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: ID or hierarchy name of desired object. For templates the slug is the ID.
parameters.name: IdOrHierarchyName

patch.description:
This is the preferred method for modifying data in the system.
If you want to do a full data replace, please use PUT instead.
If no data is effectively changed, an OK will still be returned.

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: ID or hierarchy name of desired object. For templates the slug is the ID.
parameters.name: IdOrHierarchyName

get.description: Returns JSON body with all subobjects under the Object.
get.summary: Get object and all its children.

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: ID or hierarchy name of desired object. For templates the slug is the ID.
parameters.name: IdOrHierarchyName

parameters.description: Limits the level of hierarchy for retrieval. if not specified for devices then the default value is maximum. Example: /api/devices/{id}/all?limit=2
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: specify which object field to show in response. Multiple fieldOnly can be added. An invalid field is simply ignored.
parameters.name: fieldOnly

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated >= startDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated <= endDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: endDate

get.description:
For Example: /api/sites/{id}/buildings
Will return all buildings of a site
Returns JSON body with all subobjects under the Object
get.summary: Obtain all objects 2 levels lower in the system.

parameters.description: Indicates the entity. Only values of "sites", "buildings", "rooms" are acceptable
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: ID of object
parameters.name: ID

parameters.description: Objects which 2 are levels lower in the hierarchy.
parameters.name: subent

get.description:
Gets an Object using any attribute (with the exception of description)
via query in the system
The attributes are in the form {attr}=xyz&{attr1}=abc
And any combination can be used given that at least 1 is provided.
get.summary: Gets an object filtering by attribute.

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: specify which object field to show in response. Multiple fieldOnly can be added. An invalid field is simply ignored.
parameters.name: fieldOnly

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated >= startDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: filter objects by lastUpdated <= endDate. Format: yyyy-mm-dd
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: Any other object attributes can be queried. Replace attributes here by the name of the attribute followed by its value.
parameters.name: attributes

get.description:
The path should begin with an entity name (firstEntity) and the ID of an object of this entity
followed by a hierarchal path until the desired objet, that is,
a sequence of entity names (category) and object names.
get.summary: Get an object with its full hierarchal path.

parameters.description: Root entity followed by an id. Can be: sites, buildings, rooms, racks or devices
parameters.name: firstEntity

parameters.description: id of object of firstEntity
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Hierarchal path to desired object.
parameters.name: HierarchalPath

200.description: Found. A response body will be returned with a meaningful message.

404.description: Not Found. An error message will be returned.

put.description:
This method will replace the existing data with the JSON
received, thus fully replacing the data. If you do not
want to do this, please use PATCH.
If no data is effectively changed, an OK will still be returned.

parameters.description: Entity (same as category) of the object. Accepted values: sites, domains, buildings, rooms, racks, devices, acs, panels, cabinets, groups, corridors, room-templates, obj-templates, bldg-templates, stray-devices.
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: ID or hierarchy name of desired object. For templates the slug is the ID.
parameters.name: IdOrHierarchyName
